content.question: Which of the following is a trend based on the data?

choices.label: The more chambers of Congress the president’s party controls, the less likely the president is to veto a bill.
A bill is most likely to be vetoed by the president when one party controls the House and another party controls the Senate.
The percentage of presidential vetoes overturned by Congress increases when the opposition party controls both chambers.
The president is most likely to veto a bill when the president’s party controls both chambers of Congress.

content.answer: The more chambers of Congress the president’s party controls, the less likely the president is to veto a bill.
